sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Julian of Toledo, Prognosticon futuri saeculi
Iulianus Toletanus
msDesc.p: Vellum, 217 139 , 8.6 x 5.5, ff. 1 + 140, 21 lines to a page. Cent. ix (Bradshaw), in a large upright rather heavy and coarse minuscule. The ornaments show some Celtic influence. The a is sometimes open at the top like u, sometimes of the ordinary a form.
There are a few corrections of cent. xii, very possibly in English hands, but I have not found any notes or scribbles which give a clue to the monastic provenance.
On f. ir a title and note of contents in a hand which I take to be of cent. xvi early. It is like that of MS 395. 2. Note that 395 is Catalan.

On f. iv an erasure of cent. xiii irrecoverable.
iir blank

msItem.head: Julian of Toledo, Prognosticon futuri saeculi
msItem.ab: occupied by a title in red and black capitals of cent. xii. Initial in red and green
msItem.rubric:
Incipit liber Pronosticorum futuri seculi /.
Sanctissimo ac / pre ceteris familiarissimo michi domino / ydalio Barcilonensis / sedis episcopo Iulianus Toletane sedis Episcopus
msItem.incipit: Diem illum clara ... a redemptori omnium exceptione conspicuum quo presente anno pariter in urbe regia positi

ab.decoNote: Initial in black with interlaced pattern left in white; contains a very rude figure of a nimbed man holding a book in each hand, a tree on R.
Initial with plaited work in the stem

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de origine mortis humane
msItem.incipit: Quomodo mors primum subintrauerit in mundum. Peccato primi hominis actum
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula libri secundi de animabus defuntorum quo modo habeant ante ultimam corporum resurrectionem
Incipiunt capitula libri tercii de ultima corporum resurreccione
msItem.ab: (capitals: rather an elaborate initial in red; not of Celtic pattern)
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de ultima corporum resurrecione feliciter amen

ab.decoNote: Initial with something of Celtic flavour

msItem.ab: From f. 102r to f. 115r the ink is paler and the hand seems different
On f. 115v the former aspect is resumed
The old hand ends imperfectly in capitulum lvi
msItem.explicit: Quod tamen utrum in reprobis habeatur est fortasse ambiguum quia iuxta
msItem.ab: ff. 136r to end are a supply in a good clear hand of cent. xii: ending
msItem.explicit: uenire ad regnum cuius nullus est finis

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by BA, SP, CF
remarks: Modern editor (Hillgarth) entitles text: Prognosticum future saeculi.
